text: Norbert "Ned" Locke (December 25, 1919 - February 4, 1992) was an American television personality and writer, radio announcer and politician. He was born in Red Wing, Minnesota. He was best known for the role of "Ringmaster Ned" on WGN-TV's Bozo's Circus from 1961 to 1976. He moved to Kimberling City, Missouri where he was mayor until 1992. Locke died of liver cancer in Kimberling City on February 4, 1992 at the age of 72. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:1992 deaths Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:American television writers Category:American mayors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from Minnesota Category:Writers from Minnesota Category:Politicians from Minnesota Category:Actors from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Radio personalities from Chicago Category:Television personalities from Chicago Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Actors from Missouri Category:Writers from Missouri Category:Politicians from Missouri
title: Ned Locke
